  1. # -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
  2. from django.conf import settings
  3. from patch import pre_patch, post_patch, post_patch_check
  4. import warnings
  8. def patch_settings():
  9. """Merge settings with global cms settings, so all required attributes
  10. will exist. Never override, just append non existing settings.
  12. Also check for setting inconstistence if settings.DEBUG
  13. """
  14. if patch_settings.ALREADY_PATCHED:
  15. return
  16. patch_settings.ALREADY_PATCHED = True
  18. if getattr(settings, 'CMS_FLAT_URLS', False):
  19. warnings.warn("CMS_FLAT_URLS are deprecated and will be removed in django CMS 2.4!", DeprecationWarning)
  21. if getattr(settings, 'CMS_MODERATOR', False):
  22. warnings.warn("CMS_MODERATOR will be removed and replaced in django CMS 2.4!", DeprecationWarning)
  24. from cms.conf import global_settings
  25. # patch settings
  27. pre_patch()
  29. # merge with global cms settings
  30. for attr in dir(global_settings):
  31. if attr == attr.upper() and not hasattr(settings, attr):
  32. setattr(settings._wrapped, attr, getattr(global_settings, attr))
  35. post_patch()
  37. if settings.DEBUG:
  38. # check if settings are correct, call this only if debugging is enabled
  39. post_patch_check()
  40. patch_settings.ALREADY_PATCHED = False
